definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: When we were vacationing in Indonesia, we had many different forms of satay for dinner.
sentences.chinese: 我们在印尼旅行的时候，享用了一顿丰富的沙嗲晚餐。

sentences.english: The platter with balinese satay grilled chicken wings and fried so tong.
sentences.chinese: 拼盘有巴里沙嗲烤鸡翅膀炸苏东都真的蛮好吃的。

sentences.english: Traditional Indonesian fried rice with beef satay, chicken wing and prawn crackers, topped with fried egg.
sentences.chinese: 传统印尼炒饭配牛肉沙嗲，鸡翅，虾片及煎蛋。

sentences.english: She is a clinger, trying to persuade her boy friend to buy her that bag.
sentences.chinese: 她好嗲呀，想让她男朋友帮她买那个包。

sentences.english: But at the time I really willing to eat bad belly, this is also good finish pull…
sentences.chinese: 可是当时我真的情钥嗲吃坏肚子，这样拉完也就好了。

sentences.english: She is so coquettish that I am melted.
sentences.chinese: 她好嗲啊，我骨头都酥了。

definition: to act cute/putting on adorable airs/to pretend to be lovely
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
to act like a spoiled child/to throw a tantrum/to act coquettishly
(coll.) presenting as unfriendly and blunt, but warm and tender inside (loanword from Japanese "tsundere")
